# Model setup


## Model dataset
- Data still John Day River wild Steelhead, 2005-2015
- MLE form, implemented in optim()
- **Bayesian form, implemented in JAGS**


## Constraining parameters to sum to 1
Two options:

1. Dirichlet prior (e.g., Waterhouse et al. 2020)
2. Additive log-ratio (what I have implemented so far):

$$
\begin{aligned}
o_{mcn}= \exp(a_{2})/(1 + \exp(a_{2}) + \exp(b_{2}) + \exp(c_{2}) + \exp(d_{2})) \\
s_{bon_mcn} = \exp(b_{2})/(1 + \exp(a_{2}) + \exp(b_{2}) + \exp(c_{2}) + \exp(d_{2})) \\
h_{bon_mcn} = \exp(c_{2})/(1 + \exp(a_{2}) + \exp(b_{2}) + \exp(c_{2}) + \exp(d_{2})) \\
f_{bon} = \exp(d_{2})/(1 + \exp(a_{2}) + \exp(b_{2}) + \exp(c_{2}) + \exp(d_{2})) \\
l_{bon_mcn} = 1/(1 + \exp(a_{2}) + \exp(b_{2}) + \exp(c_{2}) + \exp(d_{2}))
\end{aligned}
$$


## Priors
- Vague priors - normal with precision of 0.01 (equals SD of 10)
```{r}
a2 ~ dnorm(0, 0.01)
b2 ~ dnorm(0, 0.01)
c2 ~ dnorm(0, 0.01)
d2 ~ dnorm(0, 0.01)
```
All parameters received these priors


## Example model outputs

```{r echo = FALSE, message = FALSE}
model_outputs %>% 
  rownames_to_column("Parameter") %>% 
  dplyr::select(-c(mean, sd, X25., X75., Rhat, n.eff, overlap0, f)) %>% 
  dplyr::rename(lower2.5 = X2.5., 
                upper97.5 = X97.5.,
                median = X50.) -> param_est

# subset only those for BON to MCN
param_est %>% 
  subset(Parameter %in% c("f_bon", "h_bon_mcn", "o_mcn", "s_bon_mcn", "l_bon_mcn")) -> bon_mcn_params


```

# Next steps

## Adding covariates
1. Temperature
2. Spill
3. Juvenile history
4. Harvest (loss parameter?) - use WDFW data, summarize by river reach/state to align with model
5. Memory (overshoot?)

## Detection probability
- Implicit movements considered not detected
- For example, an individual with consecutive detections in the McNary adult fishways:
$$
o_{mcn} * p_{o_{mcn}} * f_{mcn} * (1 - p_{f_{mcn}}) * o_{mcn} * p_{o_{mcn}}
$$
Would this help us estimate detection probabilities and thus unobserved fallback?
